Context:
Apprenticeship: A form of job training that enables you to learn by doing under the supervision of a skilled individual for varying durations, with an in-school educational component.
Distance Education: George Brown College has students from all over the world studying online.
Certificate Programs: Duration is two semesters (one year).
Degree Programs: An honours bachelorâ€™s degree program lasts eight semesters (four years).
Diploma Programs: Regular diploma programs require a minimum of four semesters (two years), and advanced diplomas require six semesters (three years).
Postgraduate Certificates: Require a previous post-secondary degree or diploma for admission.
